meanings.definition: Lacking adult sophistication or experience; immature.
meanings.sent1: The callowest kitten in the litter was still learning how to groom itself.
meanings.sent2: She felt a bit callowest when faced with the complexities of the real world.
meanings.sent3: The callowest duckling tried to swim but ended up splashing everyone around.
meanings.sent4: His callowest attempt at cooking resulted in a burnt mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The callowest sapling struggled to withstand the strong winds, bending under their force.

meanings.sent1: Feeling callowest in the new job, he sought guidance from his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The callowest explorer underestimated the dangers of the uncharted territory.
meanings.sent3: Her callowest decision was to trust a stranger with her savings.
meanings.sent4: The callowest gambler believed he could win big on his first try.
meanings.sent5: The callowest artist was easily swayed by the opinions of others about his work.
